sys::Cli Class Reference

Documentation

This class contains methods to help analyze input from the command line.

Member Function Documentation

var::String sys::Cli::at ( u16  value)

Return the argument offset by value as a var::String

var::String sys::Cli::get_option_argument ( const char *  option)

Get the argument of an option as a var::String

Parameters
optionThe option to match
Returns
A String containing the option argument

For example, take the given command line program -i filename.txt

get_option_argument("-i") will return a String containing "filename.txt"

pio_t sys::Cli::get_option_pio ( const char *  option)

Get the argument of an option as a var::String

Parameters
optionThe option to match
Returns
The value of the argument or 0 if the option wasn't found

For example, take the given command line program -i 2.1

get_option_argument("-i") will return port = 2 and pin = 1

int sys::Cli::get_option_value ( const char *  option)

Get the argument of an option as a var::String

Parameters
optionThe option to match
Returns
The value of the argument or 0 if the option wasn't found

For example, take the given command line program -i 10

get_option_argument("-i") will return 10

bool sys::Cli::is_option ( const char *  value)

This method returns true if value is one of the options

Parameters
valueA pointer to the option string to search for
Returns
True if value is any of the options available

For example,

program –version -i text.txt

is_option("--version") will return true.
